The missing element is a directory in a test DB (Apache Derby). When I run the tests, the files in the DB change but I have no idea why Eclipse gets confused about these files.

Even if I delete the whole directory tree, Eclipse still insists that the file has to exist. Closing the project solves the problem but after some time, it will be back.
Seems like Resource.refreshLocal() causes the exception.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 189856 ***
